stem: A client with primary adrenal insufficiency (Addison's Disease) is admitted with a high fever and abdominal pain. Based on the documentation in the Metabolic & Adrenal Surveillance Log, which intervention is the highest priority?

tabs.title: Renal & Electrolyte Labs
tabs.content:
TestResultStatus
Serum Sodium (Na+)124 mEq/LLow
Serum Potassium (K+)6.2 mEq/LHigh
Serum Glucose42 mg/dLCritical Low
Serum Cortisol< 1.0 mcg/dLUndetectable

tabs.title: Hemodynamics
tabs.content:
Vitals: BP 68/40 (Refractory to 2L NS bolus). HR 132. Temp 102.8°F.
Condition: Client is lethargic and reports extreme weakness.

tabs.title: Medical Context
tabs.content:
Chronic Meds: Hydrocortisone 20mg PO daily.
New Factor: Client had severe gastroenteritis (Vomiting) for 2 days and was 'unable to keep my pills down.'

options.text: Administer IV Hydrocortisone sodium succinate (Solu-Cortef) immediately
Administer IV Regular Insulin to lower the potassium of 6.2
Establish a second large-bore IV and bolus 4 liters of Normal Saline
Apply a cooling blanket to treat the 102.8°F fever

rationale.correct: This is an **Acute Adrenal Crisis (Addisonian Crisis) (a1)**. Without cortisol and aldosterone, the patient cannot maintain blood pressure (BP 68/40), sodium balance (124), or glucose levels (42). The hypotension in an adrenal crisis is **refractory to fluids**; no matter how much saline you give (a3), the vessels will not constrict without steroids. Therefore, the **highest priority is IV Hydrocortisone (a1)**, which provides the missing 'stress hormone' and allows the blood pressure to recover.
clinicalPearls: Adrenal Crisis Triad: Hypotension, Hyponatremia, Hyperkalemia.
A crisis is often triggered by infection, surgery, or skipping 'stress doses' of steroids.
Treatment: 1. IV Hydrocortisone (Priority). 2. D5NS (for sugar and volume). 3. Vasopressors (if steroids don't work).

questionTrap.trap: Choosing IV Saline (a3) first because it's a 'shock' question.
questionTrap.howToOvercome: In Adrenal Crisis, the shock is *metabolic.* Fluids will 'leak out' of the vessels until the steroids stabilize the vascular tone. Always fix the 'Hormone Gap' first.

mnemonic.title: Addisonian-Add
mnemonic.expansion: Add-Sodium. Add-Sugar. Add-STEROIDS. (Because everything is missing).
